image.altText: A person in full coveralls spraying water on the road next to a sewage tanker truck on its side

props.synopsis: The daughters of a man who died in a truck crash at the bottom of the South-Eastern Freeway in 2014 have their heavily redacted victim impact statements read aloud in court, more than 11 years after their father died.

title.children: Family of man who died in freeway crash has victim statements redacted

image.altText: A CFS firefighter in firefighting helmet and clothing.

props.synopsis: Peter Curtis, who died at a bushfire ground on SA's Eyre Peninsula last month, has been remembered as a loving husband, father and grandfather, and a firefighter who "led from the front" and was a "bloody good bloke to have around".

title.children: Fallen CFS firefighter remembered as 'man of great courage'

image.altText: A group of officers wearing light blue unfiroms stand, they carry posters reading 'underpaid, understaffed, unsafe'

props.synopsis: The union representing correctional officers has voted to strike indefinitely, while officers who monitor 1,500 people on home detention will stop work for 24 hours

title.children: SA prisons remain locked down indefinitely, as home detention officers step off job

image.altText: A woman smiles at the camera while holding a pen next to coloured pens on the table and other people drawing

props.synopsis: Two Adelaide women have made it their mission to collect 2,000 Christmas cards for prisoners who'll spend this year's festive season behind bars.

title.children: Christmas cards remind prisoners they are 'not forgotten' over the holidays

image.altText: Australia men's Test cricket captain Pat Cummins wearing a hat and jacket, walking on the field

props.synopsis: Australia's captain is poised to make his return to the Ashes as Australia names its squad ahead of the third Test at the Adelaide Oval.

title.children: Cummins's return made official as Aussies name squad for Adelaide

image.altText: A woman in a hooded jacket covers her face after a court appearance.

props.synopsis: A South Australian court releases audio of prison phone calls made in the lead-up to the death of a six-year-old girl in 2022. WARNING: Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander readers are advised this article contains the first name and image of a person who has died. Readers are also advised this story contains content which may be distressing.

title.children: Phone calls by criminally neglectful mother showed 'callous disregard' for sick daughter

image.altText: Crows player Izak Rankine in casual clothes.

props.synopsis: SA Police have arrested a 31-year-old man after he allegedly sent five threatening messages on social media to a Crows player, who the ABC understands is Izak Rankine.

title.children: Arrest made after alleged threats to Crows footballer

image.altText: A police vehicle is parked on dry grass overlooking a small jetty which has yachts moored on it

props.synopsis: The body of a Western Australian man missing in waters off Coffin Bay on South Australia's Eyre Peninsula has been found.

title.children: Body of WA man who reportedly fell off jetty in regional SA waters found

image.altText: A large blue sculpture with googly eyes on it at night.

props.synopsis: A 20-year-old Mount Gambier woman appears in court in person for the first time, accused of damaging a controversial sculpture, following a campaign to raise money online for her defence.

title.children: Woman accused of googly eyes vandalism to begin negotiations with prosecution

image.altText: Ashton Hurn smiles and looks to the side in front of a large tree

props.synopsis: South Australia's new opposition leader Ashton Hurn has likened the task ahead of her to climbing a mountain, but she's taking inspiration from a family background that includes a former state cricketer and an AFL premiership captain.

title.children: Ashton Hurn likens her new job to scaling a mountain, but it follows an already rapid ascension

image.altText: A screenshot from bodycam footage of Luigi Mangione sitting at a McDonald's table, talking to a police officer.

props.synopsis: A to-do list and travel plans shed light on the steps the 27-year-old may have taken — or planned to take — to avoid capture after UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson's killing last year.

title.children: Luigi Mangione's alleged notes to self: 'Pluck eyebrows, keep momentum'

image.altText: Queensland police GPS tracker on an ankle worn by a person on a Brisbane city street.

props.synopsis: The legislation removes the requirement for either the child, or their parent or guardian, to consent to wearing the device.

title.children: Children as young as 10 to be fitted with ankle monitors under proposed laws

image.altText: A smiling blonde woman in a mortarboard hat and graduate's gown stands in front of a UQ backdrop.

props.synopsis: According to her father, Kirsten Moriarty had lodged a stalking report prior to her body being found in a car outside a NSW police station.

title.children: Woman found dead in police car park 'believed she was being stalked'

image.altText: Stacey Warnecke smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: A coroner's court has heard Melbourne nutrition influencer Stacey Warnecke died from a postpartum haemorrhage following a freebirth in September.

title.children: Melbourne influencer died from haemorrhage after freebirth, court hears

image.altText: A photo of Dau Akueng from the order of service

props.synopsis: A teen charged with the stabbing murder of a 15-year-old boy in Melbourne's west will remain in youth custody.

title.children: Melbourne teenager accused of killing Dau Akueng denied bail

image.altText: Ellenbrook secondary college sign with tree.

props.synopsis: Three more teenagers are charged over an alleged premeditated gang attack at Ellenbrook Secondary College on Monday that left a student with stab wounds.

title.children: Total of nine children charged over attack on 15yo schoolboy

image.altText: An orange bushfire burns behind a coastal town.

props.synopsis: As a bushfire rages on Tasmania's east coast, bayside resident Paul Worsteling shelters in his car, charging his phone while saltwater rains down on the roof.

title.children: Stieglitz residents stay to defend homes from bushfire

image.altText: A woman with short dark hair and glasses stands at old, worn and rusted gates, looking into the distance.

props.synopsis: Survivors still have clear memories of the invasion by Indonesia, as Timor-Leste this week commemorates the beginning of a brutal 24-year occupation.

title.children: As warplanes flew, they dropped something many in Timor-Leste had never seen

image.altText: A gorilla that looks like it's stomping with its foot up

props.synopsis: The winning images pair talented nature photography with humour that often relies on capturing a moment at just the right time.

title.children: Dancing gorilla wins funniest wildlife photo of the year

image.altText: A man in a suit pictured outside Brisbane court

props.synopsis: Alexandar Rasic pleaded guilty to unlawful striking causing the death of Michael Hayes on the Gold Coast in June, 2023.

title.children: Gold Coast man jailed for nine years over one-punch attack

image.altText: composite image featuring Tame Impala, Bumpy, Clipse, Little Simz, Paul Kelly, Lily Allen before a wall of album covers

props.synopsis: It's been an incredible year of music. Did your favourite album of 2025 make our list?

title.children: The 50 best albums of 2025: Your ultimate year-end music guide

image.altText: Wendy Sharpe stands in khaki outfit with a big bag smiling, in front of a group of east timorese children who are smiling

props.synopsis: Australia has been sending artists to the frontline since World War I, with more than 50 local artists taking part since then. But what's it actually like to head into war armed with a paintbrush?

title.children: 'Like nothing I'd ever seen': Why Australia still uses official war artists

image.altText: a pot of honey in a bush setting.

props.synopsis: Australian beekeepers are funding their own investigation into the authenticity of imported honey, with tests showing other products are being added.

title.children: What's really in your jar of supermarket honey?

image.altText: A sign warning against public alcohol consumption.

props.synopsis: The man allegedly bought large quantities of beer, champagne and rum in Darwin before selling it in WA's Kimberley region.

title.children: Money laundering charge over sizeable 'sly grogging' operation

image.altText: Dubbo Courthouse

props.synopsis: Lynette Thompson was set on fire by her partner who later committed suicide.  A coroner wants NSW police to change their procedures in dealing with domestic violence.

title.children: Police action 'inadequate' in lead-up to murder-suicide, coroner says

image.altText: Man rapping.

props.synopsis: Newcastle rapper Taison Brockbank tells the court he nearly died after being set on fire during an attack in inner-city Newcastle in 2023.

title.children: Rap musician tells court of pain and flashbacks after being set alight

image.altText: A woman with blue hair and a purple flowery shirt holds a sleeping puppy.

props.synopsis: Simone Owen is living in a tent with her husband and two children, but she says they are not considered homeless so do not qualify for crisis accommodation.

title.children: Queensland family living in a tent say they're not considered homeless

image.altText: Exterior shot of building with sign showing expansion plans

props.synopsis: A trial of artificial intelligence at Royal Perth Hospital is announced in an attempt to help health workers focus on patient care, as new data reveals WA's emergency departments are among the most stretched in the nation.

title.children: WA hospitals record worst emergency department wait times in nation

image.altText: A suburban street has been cordorned off for a crime scene.

props.synopsis: A 36-year-old woman has been airlifted to Liverpool Hospital in critical condition.

title.children: Woman critical after allegedly being run over in domestic violence incident

image.altText: A graphic shows five young men in 1920s clothing next to a still of Cillian Murphy smoking and Persian writing

props.synopsis: Morality police in Afghanistan detain several influencers who have gone viral for dressing up as 1920s gangsters in the style of BBC series Peaky Blinders.

title.children: Taliban detains men for Peaky Blinders-inspired costumes

image.altText: Ghislaine Maxwell in a white shirt, grinning at the camera

props.synopsis: The judge grants the Justice Department's request under a new law requiring the release of files related to Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.

title.children: US judge clears release of grand jury documents against Ghislaine Maxwell

image.altText: Donald Trump sits down for an interview.

props.synopsis: The US president hints he could walk away from supporting Ukraine and suggests the nation could cede territory to Moscow because "Russia has the upper hand".

title.children: Trump criticises 'decaying' Europe and says 'size will win' in Ukraine

image.altText: Pete Hegseth speaking with his hands slightly raised.

props.synopsis: What happened in the lead-up to a second strike on a speedboat in the Caribbean — who knew what and when, and who gave what order — is now under scrutiny.

title.children: 'Growing demand' for full video of US strike on 'drug boat' to be released

image.altText: A group of men sit on the back of a truck at night, some holding guns

props.synopsis: More than 140,000 civilians have been evacuated from border regions since fresh fighting between Thailand and Cambodia began on Sunday, officials said.

title.children: Tens of thousands flee Thailand-Cambodia border as fighting spreads

image.altText: A person standing next to a balloon in a field in the dark.

props.synopsis: The balloons have been causing disruptions with air traffic since October. Here's what we know.

title.children: What we know about the smuggling balloons disrupting air traffic in Lithuania
